section.section:
Subject to subsection (b) of this section, on the written request of an employee to pay dues to an organization by payroll deduction, the Central Payroll Bureau shall:
deduct the dues from the employee's wages; and
timely pay over the amount deducted to the organization.
An employee may cancel a payroll deduction of organization dues by written notification to the Central Payroll Bureau.

text.section:
The Central Payroll Bureau may deduct dues under this section only for:
an organization that has a membership of 1,000 or more State employees;
an organization for which the potential field of membership is limited to fewer than 1,000 State employees, if the Governor has approved the deduction for that organization; or
an organization for which payment of dues by payroll deduction was authorized on or before June 29, 1983.
The State Comptroller shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
